resources.string: 2- Reduced the size of the apk file
A vector is every line segment directed in space. Each vector has characteristics that are:
Origin or also called Point of application
A vector is every line segment directed in space. Each vector has characteristics that are:
Is the length or size of the vector
Is given by the orientation in the space of the line that contains it.
is indicated by an arrowhead located at the end of the vector, indicating to which side of the line of action the vector is directed.

The study of vectors is facilitated if we place them in a Cartesian decorating system that helps us to have greater precision, so as to be able to represent them in an algebraic way as well as in a geometric way

One of the characteristics is that when we have a vector that is not at the origin of our Cartesian plane, we can move it, so that the origin is always (0,0) andthus facilitate our calculations, because we will only need the end point to determine it.

Like numbers, vectors can be operated on each other, through addition, subtraction, multiplication by a scalar, division by a scalar, product point and cross product. These last two are typical of vectors.

When adding two vectors, another vector is obtained (sum or resultant vector). To obtain the sum vector it is necessary to resort to what is known as “THE PARALLELOGRAM RULE”. That is, a parallelogram is constructed that has the vectors as sides and the diagonal is drawn to obtain the vector sum.

If we want to add A + B, one is drawn after the other, moving it. The resulting vector is the one that goes from the initial point of the first vector to the end of the last one. It should be noted that the sum is commutative, that is:

When you want to add more than one vector, you proceed in the same way as before, but now they are placed one after the other until the last one. Then the line that joins the beginning of the first vector with the term of the last one is the resulting vector.

It is based on writing a vector as the sum of two others which are orthogonal (perpendicular to each other), for this it is based on the Cartesian plane, the vectors that are added are in one of the axes. The rectangular components are so called because it is based on the construction of a rectangle.

In the image you can see that the vector A is not more than the sum of one vector on the X axis and another one on the Y axis. Each of these vectors is known as the component, so the vector Ax is the component X of the vector A.
In order to write these vectors correctly, we must introduce the unit vectors, which are detailed below.
Let two vectors A and B be added, then we proceed in the graphical way that we know, which gives us as a result the vector R.

Now what we will do is write both the vector A and the B according to its components, then we realize that the sum of the components X of vector A and B, is the component X of the vector R and thus also with the axis Y.
What is the conversion of units?
The conversion of units is the transformation of a quantity, expressed in a certain unit of measurement, into another equivalent. It can be from the same system of units or not.

This process is usually done with the use of conversion factors and conversion tables. It is often enough to multiply by a fraction and the result is another equivalent measure, in which the units have changed.
When the change of units involves the transformation of several units, several conversion factors can be used one after the other.
In this way, the final result will be the equivalent measure of the units sought.
